required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of SmofKabiven Emulsion for Infusion Versus Hospital Compounded Emulsion "All in One" for Parenteral Nutrition
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of SmofKabiven Emulsion for Infusion [Multi-oil Fat Emulsion (C6-24)/Amino Acids (16)/Glucose (42%) and Electrolyte Injection] Versus Hospital Compounded Emulsion "All in One" for Parenteral Nutrition: A Randomized, Active-Controlled, Patient-blinded, Multi-Centre Study in Adult Surgical Patients Requiring Parenteral Nutrition

brief_summary.textblock: The present protocol describes a randomized, patient-blinded study in which either SmofKabiven emulsion for infusion or a hospital compounded "All in one" control Total Parenteral Nutrition (TPN) regimen will be given to adult surgical patients for 5 consecutive days. As serum prealbumin is a well-established surrogate efficacy parameter reflecting the patient´s nutritional status, the change of the serum prealbumin level at the day of the final study visit compared to baseline will represent the primary efficacy parameter in the present study. In addition, other variables will be assessed in this study, i.e., postsurgical new onset of nosocomial infection, CRP, free fatty acids, immunology parameters, the results of physical examination, vital signs, relevant nutrition- and safety-related laboratory parameters in venous blood and urine, the results of an Electrocardiography (ECG), and the number, severity, seriousness, clinical relevance, relatedness and outcome of Adverse Events (AEs). The aim of the planned study is to demonstrate that SmofKabiven emulsion for infusion is not inferior to the comparative drug (hospital compounded "All in one" emulsion for parenteral nutrition).

study_design_info.masking_description: Allocation to the treatment arms will not be known to the patient

secondary_outcome.description: Postsurgical new onset of nosocomial infection

secondary_outcome.measure: Thromboxane B3 (TX B3) / Thromboxane B2 (TX B2)
Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4) / Cluster of Differentiation 8 (CD8)

other_outcome.description: Coded according to Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Affairs (MedDRA) by System Organ Class (SOC) and preferred term
Examination of the head to detect significant medical aberrance
Examination of mouth to detect significant medical aberrance
Examination of the nose to detect significant medical aberrance
Examination of the throat to detect significant medical aberrance
Examination of the tonsils to detect significant medical aberrance
Examination of the eyes to detect significant medical aberrance (according to standard of care following the discretion of the treating physician)
Examination of the neck to detect significant medical aberrance
Examination of the lungs and chest to detect significant medical aberrance
Examination of the breasts to detect significant medical aberrance
Examination of the cardiovascular system to detect significant medical aberrance (according to standard of care following the discretion of the treating physician)
Examination of the abdomen to detect significant medical aberrance
Examination of the genitalia to detect significant medical aberrance
Examination of the musculoskeletal to detect significant medical aberrance (according to standard of care following the discretion of the treating physician)
Examination of the skin to detect significant medical aberrance
Examination of the neurological system to detect significant medical aberrance (according to standard of care following the discretion of the treating physician)
Examination of the lymph nodes to detect significant medical aberrance
Examination of the ears to detect significant medical aberrance,
Electrocardiogram to assess cardiac disorders (e.g. Myocardial infarction, Pericarditis, QT interval Prolongation, etc.)

arm_group.description: SmofKabiven emulsion for infusion will be continuously infused intravenously via central venous access for approximately 14-24 h/d. Duration of treatment with the study drug is 5 consecutive days.Targeted daily dose is 26.3 ml/kg bw/day resulting in 29.3 kcal/kg bw/day. Dosage on D 1 will be reduced to 50%.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Hospital compounded "All in one" emulsion for PN
arm_group.description: Hospital compounded "All in one" emulsion will be continuously infused intravenously via central venous access for approximately 14-24 h/d. Duration of treatment with the study drugs will be 5 consecutive days.Targeted daily dose is 26.3 ml/kg bw/day resulting in 29.3 kcal/kg bw/day. Dosage on D 1 will be reduced to 50%.

intervention.arm_group_label: Hospital compounded "All in one" emulsion for PN

The Second Hospital of Jilin University
The First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University
